qas.question: Which gender was exempt from performing the yearly corvee labor duties?
What emotional state would empresses commonly place their immediate family members in?
What type of occupation did women commonly take part in?
Who were women obligated to obey in their old age?
Which parental figures often avoided the common familial rules?

context: Women were expected to obey the will of their father, then their husband, and then <a3_0>their adult son<a3_0/> in old age. However, it is known from contemporary sources that there were many deviations to this rule, especially in regard to <a4_0>mothers<a4_0/> over their sons, and empresses who ordered around and <a1_0>openly humiliated<a1_0/> their fathers and brothers. <a0_0>Women<a0_0/> were exempt from the annual corvée labor duties, but often engaged in a range of <a2_0>income-earning<a2_0/> occupations aside from their domestic chores of cooking and cleaning.
